headline: Cadence Accelerates Physical AI Applications with Tensilica NeuroEdge 130 AI Co-Processor
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 07, 2025--The Cadence Tensilica NeuroEdge 130 AI Co-Processor complements any NPU to enable end-to-end execution of the latest agentic and physical AI networks.

raw.headline: Cadence Accelerates Physical AI Applications with Tensilica NeuroEdge 130 AI Co-Processor
raw.summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 07, 2025--The Cadence Tensilica NeuroEdge 130 AI Co-Processor complements any NPU to enable end-to-end execution of the latest agentic and physical AI networks.

headline: Cadence unveils new Nvidia-based supercomputer as it pushes into engineering, biotech software
summary: SANTA CLARA, California (Reuters) -Cadence Design Systems unveiled on Wednesday a new supercomputer based on chips from Nvidia that will speed up its software offerings for everything from designing chips to jets to new drugs.  On Wednesday, Cadence announced that it has reworked many of those core programs to run on Nvidia's latest "Blackwell" graphics processors, or GPUs.  Cadence's new Millennium M2000 supercomputer will contain about 32 of Nvidia's newest chips and will cost about $2 million for the most common configurations, though final pricing has not been set, Cadence executives said Wednesday.

headline: Cadence Unveils Millennium M2000 Supercomputer with NVIDIA Blackwell Systems to Transform AI-Driven Silicon, Systems and Drug Design
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., May 07, 2025--The new Cadence Millennium M2000 Supercomputer featuring NVIDIA Blackwell systems delivers AI-accelerated simulation at unmatched speed and scale.
